name: sfchronicle
text: CALIFORNIA FIRES LIVE UPDATES: Plumas County Sheriff issues mandatory evacuation notice: Residents living along Highway 70 from Chandler Road east to Squirrel Creek Road (also known as the Road to Argentine) must evacuate, officials said. https://t.co/c8ljp3EDc6 https://t.co/e1lCkVJUfR

name: sfchronicle

name: sfchronicle
text: Chris Clark, chief deputy of the Santa Cruz County Sheriff‚Äôs Office, said the ongoing CZU Complex fire poses ‚Äúno imminent fire danger to city of Santa Cruz.‚Äù  The fire grew slightly overnight to 78,000 acres and is now 13% contained.  https://t.co/H4LKgjNmI4 https://t.co/4UWD6Ij58Z

name: sfchronicle
text: Three people were arrested for being in the CZU Complex evacuation area, two who had other arrest warrants and one a woman from San Francisco, Cal Fire officials said. Six people entered restricted areas to inspect their property and had to be rescued.   https://t.co/JXlM7WeCxg https://t.co/1IjCc8GVxE

name: sfchronicle
text: With personnel coming to the Bay Area from throughout the state as well as other parts of the country, health experts fear a ‚Äúsuper-spreader‚Äù event if someone infected on the front lines brings the virus back home. https://t.co/1Bv5EMRX4T
